intro: Patinoa paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Patinoa, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found near rivers and streams. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
